column4: hi, i am trying to ssh to my linux machine inside of the lan, it just stays there and doesn't ask for the password.
I am thinking that its either a firewall issue?
or port forwarding?
I have set the router to forwar the 22 port to the linux machine.
most common problem is a firewall, however I don't think Ubuntu has one on in a default setup. You might look at sshd.conf in /etc/ to see what mode of authentication openssh is using
okay, i will look into it.
I'm not sure what the default sshd.conf looks like in Ubuntu.. but it might set to accept key authentication instead of password
Oh? I was able to log in fine though...so does that mean my key is alright?
I thought you were not able to log in... it just sat twiddling its thumbs when trying to log on
yeah, the connection would time out :(
so at first, i thought it was the router, then i thought it could be just the firewall.
so you were logged into an account and then it would time out?
no, when i type in ssh <ip addr> from my Mac, it would just do nothing.
so then what is your problem now?
nothig, its fixed.  i was just investigating what i had to do with the /etc/ stuff you guys were mentioning earlire.
nothing I guess but I would highly suggest that you change "Allow root login yes" to no
hm, isn't that set no as default though?

it should be "sshd.conf" not ssh.conf and it should be under /etc/
